title: World Cup 2022: Kieran Trippier has to start for England, says Alan Shearer
description: Kieran Trippier has to start for England in the World Cup against Iran, according to former Three Lions striker Alan Shearer.

title: Peter Kay announces return to stand-up during I'm A Celebrity
description: The comedian's comeback was announced during an ad break in Sunday's I'm A Celebrity launch episode.

title: COP27: Sunak urges global push to boost clean growth
description: The PM will tell world leaders at the COP27 summit to deliver on promises to tackle global warming.

title: England: Head coach Eddie Jones does not see 'really strong problems' despite Twickenham defeat
description: England head coach Eddie Jones does not see "really strong problems" despite a disappointing defeat by Argentina at Twickenham.

title: Ronnie O'Sullivan beats Judd Trump in Champion of Champions
description: Ronnie O'Sullivan beats defending champion Judd Trump 10-6 to claim his fourth Champion of Champions title.

title: US midterms: Why the economy may decide the vote
description: Democrats have faltered in their messaging on the economy, while Republicans have hammered them.

title: World Cup 2022: 'He looks a little lost' - should England stick with Raheem Sterling?
description: Should Gareth Southgate stick with Raheem Sterling in England's first game of the World Cup against Iran despite his poor form for Chelsea?

title: Manchester United 1-3 Chelsea: United suffer first defeat of season
description: Chelsea scored two goals in four minutes to end Manchester United's unbeaten start to the Women's Super League season at Leigh Sports Village.

title: Garth Crooks' Team of the Week: Alisson, Trippier, Maddison, Salah, Zaha
description: Who reminds Garth Crooks of Son Heung-min? Whose finishing is getting better? And who could England use in Qatar? It's the team of the week.

title: Tottenham 1-2 Liverpool: Why Reds' win may prove vital
description: Liverpool's win over Tottenham must serve as a template for the rest of the season, writes BBC Sport's chief football writer Phil McNulty.

title: Aston Villa 3-1 Man Utd: Unai Emery off to a flyer as Erik ten Hag rues 'stupid' decisions
description: Aston Villa fans hope Unai Emery's appointment could spark a revival after they beat Manchester United, who hope their "unacceptable" display is an off day.

title: Made.com expected to go into administration this week
description: Around 500 staff are expected to lose their jobs after the online furniture store failed to find a buyer.

title: Arsenal beat Chelsea: Are Gunners now ‘the real deal’?
description: Arsenal reach a "new level" in their victory over Chelsea, but are the leaders good enough to sustain a serious challenge for the title?

title: Tottenham Hotspur 1-2 Liverpool: Mohamed Salah scores double in Reds win
description: Mohamed Salah strikes twice in the first half as Liverpool return to winning ways in the Premier League with victory at Tottenham.

title: Leicester City 0-4 Arsenal: Jonas Eidevall's Gunners reclaim Women's Super League top spot
description: Arsenal continue their perfect start to the Women's Super League season by thrashing bottom side Leicester to reclaim top spot.

title: Standoff as Italy stops male migrants from disembarking rescue ship
description: The new far-right government allows only vulnerable people to leave a migrant ship stuck for two weeks.

title: England 29-30 Argentina: Pumas land famous win at Twickenham
description: England make a sobering start to their autumn campaign as Argentina pull off an audacious and deserved victory.

title: COP27: Jailed activist Alaa Abdel Fattah begins 'water strike'
description: Alaa Abdel Fattah's family have urged Rishi Sunak to secure his release at the COP27 climate summit.

title: Aston Villa 3-1 Manchester United: Unai Emery enjoys perfect start as Villa boss
description: Unai Emery enjoys a dream debut as Aston Villa manager with a first home victory against Manchester United in 23 years.

title: Ukraine war: Kyiv Mayor Klitschko warns of evacuations if power lost
description: Millions of Ukrainians have intermittently lost electricity and water after Russian air strikes.

title: Rail passengers urged to check Monday travel
description: Most train companies will operate limited services on Monday despite strikes being called off.

title: World Cup 2022: 10 European football associations respond to Fifa's 'focus on football' letter
description: Ten European football associations including England and Wales say "human rights are universal and apply everywhere" after Fifa asked nations competing at the Qatar World Cup to "now focus on the football".

title: Ed Davey: Tories have betrayed British people
description: The Lib Dem leader says his party will "end the chaos" that saw three prime ministers in two months.

title: St Johnstone 2-1 Rangers: Saints stun Rangers who slip up in title race
description: A James Brown rocket helps St Johnstone stun Rangers and leave the Ibrox side seven points behind Celtic in the Scottish Premiership title race.

title: Chelsea 0-1 Arsenal: Gabriel scores as Gunners return to top of Premier League
description: Arsenal return to the top of the Premier League table as Gabriel's close-range finish gives them a win against Chelsea at Stamford Bridge.

title: Twitter users jump to Mastodon - but what is it?
description: The little-known social network's user base has swelled after Elon Musk's takeover of Twitter.

title: Glastonbury Festival ticket sale hit by technical issue
description: Festival organisers apologised for the problem and announced a ticket resale in spring 2023.

title: Fireworks thrown at crews tackling bonfire blazes
description: Crews were targeted and vehicles were damaged on one of the busiest nights for 999 crews.

title: T20 World Cup: India set up England semi-final with 71-run win over Zimbabwe
description: England will face India in the semi-finals of the Men's T20 World Cup as Rohit Sharma's side beat Zimbabwe by 71 runs.

title: Suryakumar Yadav's brilliant innings againmst Zimbabwe at T20 World Cup
description: Suryakumar Yadav plays a series of 'outrageous' shots to score 61 from 25 balls and guide India to a total of 186-5 against Zimbabwe at eth T20 World Cup in Australia.

title: Tanzanian Precision Air plane crashes into Lake Victoria
description: The plane was carrying 43 people, 26 of whom have been rescued and sent to hospital, an official says.

title: New York fire: Moment woman rescued by firefighters with a rope
description: A woman is pulled from an apartment block in New York after a blaze left at least 38 people injured.

title: Houston Astros win World Series 4-2 by beating Philadelphia Phillies 4-1 in game six
description: The Houston Astros win their second World Series title as a 4-1 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies helps them clinch the seven-game series 4-2.

title: Sunak aware Gavin Williamson faced bullying claim, says MP
description: PM was told of complaint before he gave Sir Gavin Williamson a cabinet job, former party chair says.

title: T20 World Cup: South Africa out after shock loss to Netherlands
description: South Africa are out of the Men's T20 World Cup after being stunned by Netherlands in their final group match.

title: Duelling US presidents descend on key swing state Pennsylvania
description: Trump, Obama and Biden all rally in Pennsylvania, urging Americans to vote in the midterm elections.

title: COP27: 'Watershed moment' as UN climate summit begins
description: Nations are being urged to turn pledges into action as the UN climate conference opens in Egypt.

title: The Art of the Terraces: How football fans led a fashion revolution
description: The style and fashion of football casuals is celebrated in a new exhibition in Liverpool.

title: US midterms: Why abortion matters in these crucial elections
description: Inflation is voters' top issue, but Democrats hope anger over abortion bans will boost turnout.

title: Your pictures on the theme of 'sculpture'
description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

title: Why high UK energy bills were decades in the making
description: Former energy ministers and experts highlight mistakes they say are partly to blame for steep bills.

title: Extra bank holiday approved to mark King's coronation
description: The holiday will fall on Monday, 8 May, two days after the coronation of King Charles III.

title: The Papers: Hacking gang targets VIPs and I'm a Celeb build-up
description: The front pages cover on a mix of stories including claims British businesses and officials are being targeted by cyber criminals.

title: James Maddison: Match of the Day analysts say midfielder must go to World Cup with England
description: Match of the Day's Gary Lineker, Jermaine Jenas and Danny Murphy analyse midfielder James Maddison's display in Leicester's 2-0 win over Everton.

title: Twitter confirms fee for blue-tick verification after Musk takeover
description: Controversially Twitter says blue-tick status will be open to those who pay a monthly $7.99.
